assets:mint.description: Mints assets in batches using a spreadsheet.

input.name: input
input.description: Excel file with the templates and amounts

config:auth.description: Authenticates the CLI with a different account

examples.description: Logs in to the CLI with a different account

config:init.description: Configure the parameters to interact with the blockchain.

generate.description: Generates files to use in other batch commands.

generate:mint-file.description: Generates the file to batch mint assets in a collection. Each schema will be a different sheet.

examples.description: Generates the file for the collection alpacaworlds, schema thejourney and saves it in the current directory in a file called mints.xlsx.
Generates the file for the collection alpacaworlds, all schemas and saves it in the current directory in a file called mints.xlsx.

collection.name: collection
collection.description: Collection name to generate the file.

schema.name: schema
schema.description: Schema to use to generate the file. If not provided, all schemas will be used.

output.name: output
output.description: Location where the file will be generated.

generate:pfp-file.description: Generates the file to generate a pfp collection with the specified layers.

examples.command: <%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> pfp-layers.xlsx -l Body -l Face -l Hair
examples.description: Generates the file to create pfps with the layers Body, Face and Hair and saves it in the current directory in a file called pfp-layers.xlsx.

examples.command: <%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> pfp-layers.xlsx -l Body -l Face -l Hair -a
examples.description: Generates the file to create pfps with the layers Body, Face and Hair with advanced headers and saves it in the current directory in a file called pfp-layers.xlsx.

layers.name: layers
layers.description: The names of the layers to include in the file.

output.name: output
output.description: Location where the file will be generated.

generate:template-file.description: Generates the file to batch create templates in a collection. Each schema will be a different sheet.

examples.description: Generates the file for the collection alpacaworlds, schema thejourney and saves it in the current directory in a file called templates.xlsx.
Generates the file for the collection alpacaworlds, all schemas and saves it in the current directory in a file called templates.xlsx.

collection.name: collection
collection.description: Collection name to generate the file.

schema.name: schema
schema.description: Schema to use to generate the file. If not provided, all schemas will be used.

output.name: output
output.description: Location where the file will be generated.

pfps:generate.description: Generates the images and attributes for a pfp collection.

examples.description: Generates all the pfps defined in the pfps-specs.xlsx file and saves them in the pfps directory.

rootDir.name: rootDir
rootDir.description: Directory where the assets are stored.

resizeWidth.name: resizeWidth
resizeWidth.description: Width to resize the images to.

input.name: input
input.description: Location or google sheets id of the excel file with the pfps definitions.

output.name: output
output.description: Directory where the images will be saved.

pfps.description: Commands to manage a PFP collection.

templates:create.description: Create templates in a collection by batches using a spreadsheet.

input.name: input
input.description: Excel file with the assets to mint

templates:export.description: Exports the templates in a collection. Each schema will be a different sheet.

examples.description: Exports the templates for the collection alpacaworlds, schema thejourney and saves it in the current directory in a file called templates.xlsx.
Exports the templates for the collection alpacaworlds, all schemas and saves it in the current directory in a file called templates.xlsx.

collection.name: collection
collection.description: Collection name to generate the file.

schema.name: schema
schema.description: Schema to use to generate the file. If not provided, all schemas will be used.

output.name: output
output.description: Location where the file will be generated.
